page.title: 18HOUSING AROUND CRAWLEY DOWN
page.content: Most people in Crawley Down and Turners Hill live in their own {detached}or{semi_detached houses. There are few{bungalows}or{flats}in either village. In Turners Hill 30% of houses are{rented}but in Crawley Down under 7% are. The majority of houses in both villages have{3 or 4 bedrooms and{central heating.}The{fuel}most used in Crawley Down is{gas}but it is not available in Turners Hill, so{oil and{solid fuel}are used. In Crawley Down 60% of the houses have been built since{1970,}mainly on the{Burleighwood estate. In contrast, 50% of the houses in Turners Hill were built{between {1945 and 1970.}Since then building land has been scarce and only 20% of the houses date from{after 1970. Nearly 25% of the houses in Turners Hill were built before{The Great War whereas only 7% in Crawley Down were.
